New Records: Pete Alonso's homer was No. 220 of his career, tying him with Mike Piazza for third place on the Mets’ all-time list.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a solo homer in the second inning.
Sean Manaea pitched strong into the seventh inning.
The Mets had a fifth-inning breakout, scoring six runs.
Corbin Carroll hit a two-run homer for the Diamondbacks.
Reed Garrett, Phil Maton, Danny Young, and Adam Ottavino provided shutout relief for the Mets.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized the importance of winning baseball games.
Pete Alonso expressed that tying Mike Piazza's home run record was special as Piazza was his childhood hero.
